instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.P3V3G3S_EN: What is P3V3G3S_EN? P3VG3S_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_G3S power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.P5VG3S_PGOOD: What is P5VG3S_PGOOD? P5VG3S_PGOOD is a signal that indicates that the PP5V_G3S power rail is functioning properly. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Hello 

I got a Macbook Pro with liquid damage in the sectors
L9021
<CAPACITOR>C9081</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C9593</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C9592</CAPACITOR>
The damage is only on the edges of the motherboard
I did a cleaning but the Mac does not turn on, this is the first time that I work with this motherboard and I am lost, I do not know where to start

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at L9020/30/80.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message: Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.62V
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> 3.383V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
It is recognized in DFU?
If not, check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages come on and steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Not recognized in dfu
I check all lines of AWAKE and SLPS2R 
<SIGNAL>SOC_BLUE_AWAKE</SIGNAL> Not present 
<SIGNAL>SOC_RED_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> Not Present

all other lines come on and steady normal with his correct voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Yes, it recognizes it in DFU, I tried to restore the system but it gives me an error.
[ATTACH type="full"]60362[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Seems to have problems with its SSD.
Do you get voltage on SSD coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message: Yes i have voltage in all the ssd coils

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
The error is SSD related.
Probably corrosion already damaged SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message: what can i do in this case?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Not to much, if SSD got damaged.
Did you try both DFU revive and restore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
yes a tried to restore with another T2 Mac and apple configurator but I got an error, the one I sent you in the photo.

I had to remove some caps that had corrosion damage
<CAPACITOR>C9592</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C9593</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C9081</CAPACITOR>
and I havenÂ´t put them back because I do not have these cap at this time
Do you think the failure could be related to that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
The mentioned caps shouldn't be related; all of them are filter caps.

Do you get correct voltage on SSD coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message: yes i have the correct voltage on SSD coils, some of them have a little of damage corrosion, but it is only on the top not at the base where they are soldered.[ATTACH type="full"]60363[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60364[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60365[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Then I can only suspect SSD area.
Possibly overvoltage caused by initial corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message: There is some possibility of discarding by taking memories, this mac has 6 memories and I have a good reballing technique, so just tell me what I have to do and I do it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
I recommend to check first all the resistors from SSD area.
One corroded resistor is enough to block the communication.
Check the basic signals of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
ok, I already checked the resistances related to ssd and they are all good, I tried again to restore and now it gave me another error
How can I check the basic signals of the <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>?
[ATTACH type="full"]60368[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
You should follow a power on seuquence for T2 boards.
We have 01598 and 01055 already posted on the forum.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oBr-qxYVfghYimgX6pwkNbwSjpQfYbKq/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
I already reviewed the entire sequence and I have some doubts with these lines
<SIGNAL>P1V1_SLPDDR_SOCFET_EN</SIGNAL> 1.8V
<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P3V3G3S_EN</SIGNAL> 1.8V
<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 1.8V

All voltages are present up to the <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> line.

When the power button is activated, the voltage of the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> line is not generated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Always when have doubts with signals, check where the pull-up resistor is connected.
Usually enable signals are 3.3V; sometime 1.8V, because corresponding chip is powered from 1.8V too.
Same applies for power good signals.
Don't make confusion between a power rail and its enable, or power good signal!!!

I still bet for SSD damage and T2 can't complete DFU because cannot access its firmware partition.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
What can i do now? 
I want to try everything possible.
I've already checked all the bad sectors many times and I've checked all the voltages and resistors and I don't care if the board dies in the process but I don't want to give up please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A With liquid damage It does not turn on
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board is many times a nightmare and lost cause.
We cannot choose which part want to be affected.

Try to put the board in ultrasonic bath.
Dry it correctly at the end.
